channel.title: programming on CipherBlog
channel.description: Recent content in programming on CipherBlog

item.title: How to Ask a Question
item.description: It’s September again! Today’s the 10,640th September. People usually ask me questions related to IT, specially related to programming. Many questions are just garbage. People don’t know to ask questions the right way. I see many of these “garbage” questions on stackoverflow. When I see them, I just leave a advice in the comments and move on, but if the question is utter garbage, I immediatly downvote. This is the same procedure many other stackoverflow users follow.

item.title: Generate QR codes quickly in linux terminal
item.description: Recently I had to type a long password to an app, but it’s super complex that typing is a headache. Password was in my password manager on laptop I decided to transfer the password using QR codes and then copy it. Generating a QR is nothing hard these days, tons of online services for this now, but the thing is, my data is sensitive. Online services are not an option.
